title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.5: EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE - EDUCATION

description.narrative: Output 2.5: Government and non-government partners adopt risk-informed approaches to emergency preparedness, planning and response to humanitarian needs of the education sector, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2 - Improved Early Learning and Education: An increased proportion of children aged 0 to 18, especially girls from most disadvantaged counties, informal settlements and those affected by humanitarian crisis, access quality, gender- sensitive Early Child Development (ECD) and education services, with increased transition to secondary education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.5: Government and non-government partners adopt risk-informed approaches to emergency preparedness, planning and responseto humanitarian needs of the education sector

description.narrative: 222,833 children reached through pre-primary, primary and secondary Education in refugee settlements and host communities as well as in arid and semi-arid lands. Out of this, 6,447 overaged children were provided with Accelerated Education program. 10,509 adolescents and youth supported through skill development program. 97,138 adolescents & community influencers were reached with information on available skills training and available opportunities in refugee settlements. UNICEF provided face masks, handwashing stations and printings to assess children needs in pre-primary and primary education towards school reopening. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:28/12/2021
